title: Tour Te Waipounamu 2026
body:
Bikes of Tour Te Waipounamu 2026
22 January, 2026
Powered By:
Rufus Wenlock
Age
: 38
Location
: NZ
Bike
: Süfur - prototype 32”
Key items of kit
: Massive frame bag made by Tailfin. This has all my clothing, sleep system and food.
Albion cargo vest with 2lt water + snacks + spares.
Tailfin top tube bag with all my electronics.
750ml bottle on top tube.
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Steel
Wheel size
: Other
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: Yes
Sami Sauri
Age
: 33
Location
: chamonix
Bike
: Frame : Rose bikes - PDQ hard tail
Wheels: Zipp 1ZERO HITOP SW
Drivetrain:
Crankset: Sram XX SL Eagle 32 chainring
Cassette: Sram XX SL Eagle10-52
Rear derailleur: Sram XX SL Eagle TType
Key items of kit
: Controllers: Pod Ultimate controler
Handlebar: flat bar + aero zipp handlebars
Saddle: Selle San Marco Shortfit 2.0 Supercomfort
Tires: Schwalbe Racing Ralph and Racing Ray 2.35”
Pedals: Time pedals
Hammerhead device
Light front Supernova B54 pro with battery (50+hours)
Rear light - can’t remember
All bags from Tailfin (white ones are custom made)
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: Yes
Jade Saskia Simpson-Field
Age
: 34
Location
: Leeds, UK
Bike
: I'll be riding my Cube AMS One11 C:68 TM with a dropper, Son dynamo, k-lite front light and silly loop handlebars.
Key items of kit
: I've got my tent (Nemo Hornet Elite), sleeping bag (S2S Spark 3), mat (S2S) and PJs, as well as full water proofs and some extra warm layers. Loads of food. Hikeahike harness. Flat pedals and sandals. And NZ specifics - loads of suncream, spork for ice cream consumption and pineapple lumps!
Frame type
: MTB - Full Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Angus Young
Age
: 29
Location
: Dorset, Uk
Bike
: Yeti ASR with Hunt wheels
Key items of kit
: Restrap bags, exposure lights (loads of them), Precision fuel and hydration, Le Col clothing.
Frame type
: MTB - Full Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: Yes
Sam Horgan
Age
: 38
Location
: Christchurch
Bike
: BMC Two Stroke AL
Rock Shox SID + SRAM X01 AXS.
Profile Aerobars, SQLabs Toggles.
Tailfin Aeropack + Revelate Frame Bag + Revelate Pitckfork.
Key items of kit
: MLD Bivy, Sea to Summit Sleeping Bag, Thermarest Neoair Sleeping Mat.
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Aluminium
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: Yes
Jak Brightwell
Age
: 24
Location
: Wellington
Bike
: I’ll be riding the 2018 Specialized Epic Hardtail I stole from my mum! It’s running a $17 carbon dynamo wheel I got from TradeMe hooked up to Supernova lights, Salsa bend bars with carbon aerobars, Ergon touch points (grips, saddle, and squishy seatpost), SRAM 12 speed drivetrain and new 2-pot Shimano brakes.
Key items of kit
: DansBagsTM has gone all in with a custom roll-top frame bag and stretchy top tube bag. The rear bag is held on with a Wayward riders Louise harness, and a Revelate Pronghorn up front. I’ll also be wearing a Restrap vest for extra bits. For hydration I’ve got a StudioForecast double bottle cage mount, and I’ll be navigating using a Coros Dura.
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Sam Snowden
Age
: 34
Location
: Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington
Bike
: Yeti ASR
Key items of kit
: Sleep - Sea to Summit Spark / Sol Escape Bivi
Warm - OR Synthetic
Eat - Everything
Frame type
: MTB - Full Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Mike Norman
Age
: 57
Location
: Cabarita Beach, Australia
Bike
: Santa Cruz tall boy Dt Swiss carbon wheels, One Up dropper, Burgtec flat pedals, SRAM shifting n brakes.
Key items of kit
: Bike bag dude frame bag small bag front n rear. Sea to Summit sleeping bag, Fenix lights and Sol bivy.
Frame type
: MTB - Full Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Electronic shifting
: No
Bevan Collins
Age
: 51
Location
: Kerikeri, Northland, NZ
Bike
: Binary Bicycles SuperB XC, Shimano XTR components, kLite lights powered by a Son dynamo and 2.35 Mezcals.
Key items of kit
: Sea to Summit Traveller sleeping bag, Outdoor Research Helium Bivy, Paper Roads Aotearoa custom frame bag and Apidura bags and 2L hydration pack.
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Titanium
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: Yes
Dean Ford
Age
: 47
Location
: Wellington
Bike
: Trek Superfly, SID 100mm forks, Wheelworks carbon wheels, Shimano XT 12-speed 30T x 10-51, Mezcal 2.35 tyres, closed-foam-taped-to-the-down-tube carry system.
Key items of kit
: Bivy, lightweight mat and sleeping bag, Fenix lights, lots of bag space for stocking up at resupply
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Loic
Age
: 27
Cap number
: 420
Location
: Hobart . Australia
Bike
: Santa Cruz Highball 27.5
Key items of kit
: Big custom top tube bag by Paul, frame bag collab with Mum, flat pedals
Rekon Race front and rear 2.35, TT bars, sleeping mat and emergency bivvy and DT Swiss EX471 Rim for chunk.
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 650b (27.5")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Simon Eglinton
Age
: 29
Location
: Adelaide, South Australia
Bike
: I'm riding a Santa Cruz Chameleon v7 with a 140mm fox 34 + transfer dropper. Groupset is a mix of 12 speed SLX and XT with 30/10-51 gearing and 4 piston stoppers. Tyres are 2.4 maxxis rekon race on sector carbon wheels. Stooge moto bars for the perfect backsweep and bucket loads of clamp area.
Key items of kit
: Nav is a coros dura. Bags are mostly revelate/miss grape il coso with a home made frame wedge, aerobar feedbag and hike-a-bike harness. Salomon 12 litre on the back. Lights are cleanskin with replaceable 18650s. Shoes are specialized recon 3.0 with the toe flex for comfy hiking. Sleep will be in an MLD bivvy, -1 bag and a cut out of closed cell foam. 3L water capacity.
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Aluminium
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Nick Edwards
Age
: 35
Location
: Melbourne, Australia
Bike
: Cervelo ZHT-5
Key items of kit
: Tailfin aero rack and bags , Exposure lights
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Darryl Carpenter
Age
: 60
Location
: Wellington
Bike
: Trek Procaliber 9.6
Key items of kit
: Mix of Revelate & Blackburn bags, aero bars, Sea2Summit fly sheet, SOL bivvy, Macpac Firefly sleeping bag, Ground Effect & Icebreaker kit, Garmin suite of electronics, cuddly toy for long days in the saddle & a set of water wings for river crossings
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Jim Ashley
Age
: 999
Cap number
: ?
Location
: Wellington
Bike
: This Year I'm cartwheeling down Te Waipounamu on the exact same setup as my last lap, with the exception of more or less everything...
I'll be riding a dream machine Yeti ASR (29", 120 mm front 115 mm, rear travel, 150 mm dropper) with mismatched wheels wrapped in Conti Dubnital rubber.
Key items of kit
: I'm carrying an eclectic collection of bags; the remarkably stable Tailfin Top tube bag is my pantry come busy drawer, my 140 g frame bag from Paper Roads mostly houses my 7Mesh rain gear, a LGTM Harness cable tied to a bent bit of metal from Get Lost holds my sleep stuff, and a wee black diamond pack carries everything else. A Way Way Harder Harness will free up both hands up the Dam(n)pier, and a Garmin 540 will be my guiding star and primary companion for this edition.
Lighting & Charging is managed by a Son 28 -> Sinewave beacon and Spurcycle bell is there for all non-verbal communication with dot watchers and ghosts.
Bring on the ICU.
Frame type
: MTB - Full Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Matt Dewes
Age
: 40
Location
: Kapiti Coast, New Zealand
Bike
: Giant XTC, 1x11, 32T front chainring, 11-46T cassette. SID Ultimate fork, Vittoria Mezcals 2.25 Tyres on carbon rims
Key items of kit
: Revelate Designs bags, Wayward Riders Louise harness + Ortlieb 7L dry bag, UltrAspire backpack, SOL bivvy, Cumulus sleeping bag, Garmin forerunner 955, Fenix BC26R light (on bars) and Led Lenser MH10 headtorch (mounted on helmet).
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 45-50mm
Electronic shifting
: No
Gary Lindbom
Age
: 53
Location
: Timaru, New Zealand
Bike
: Canyon Exceed CF SLX
Key items of kit
: Restrap race seat bag and front bag, both 7l. Restrap frame bag. OR helium bivy, Exped synmat UL sleeping pad. Fenix BC26R front light and Fenix HM70R head torch, both using 5000mAh 21700 batteries. Wahoo Roam V3. Vittoria Mezcal 2.25 tyres
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: Yes
Daniel
Age
: 45
Bike
: Ibis Exie 31 with Öhlins suspension, XTR drivetrain and brakes, Ergon saddle on OneUp dropper, OneUp/Deda/SQlab cockpit, Duke/Sapim/Erase/Vittoria wheels…
Key items of kit
: Mixed off-the-shelf bags, Wahoo/InReach/Suunto/Nitecore/Exposure electronics, Rab/Borah sleeping system, 7mesh 3-layer shell and puffer, Cafe du Cycliste shirt, Albion shorts, Fizik shoes with Ergon insoles…
Frame type
: MTB - Full Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Wolferine
Age
: 43
Location
: Kaikoura
Bike
: Santa Cruz highball, painted in olive drab. Shimano 12 speed and Wheelworks hoops.
Key items of kit
: Bum gravey chamois cream. The rest I don't need but will definitely help get me to Slope Point.
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Evan Caygill
Location
: Christchurch
Bike
: Giant Fathom 2023
Key items of kit
: Fox transfer dropper, Pro Missile aero bars, Mezcal 2.35 tires, Stealth frame bag, Tailfin top tube bag, Wayward Riders Louise dropper post harness. Bike serviced by the team at Chill.
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Aluminium
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Matty King
Age
: 43
Location
: New Plymouth NZ
Bike
: Binary Super B, Rockshox Sid SL fork, XTR/XT drivechain/brakes, K-Lite/Son dynamo charging/lighting system, Chris King/Stans Arch wheelset, Continental RaceKing tyres, Redshift post, Salsa Bend bar 23' and Ergon Grips / Profile aerobars.
Key items of kit
: Garmin Edge 850, Paper Roads custom frame bag, Shimano GE900 shoes and Tineli rainwear.
Em St John
Age
: 33
Location
: Christchurch
Bike
: Santa Cruz Chameleon
Key items of kit
: Revelate feed bags, Restrap top tube bag, Bivvy and sleeping bag and
Ortlieb seat post bag.
Bryce Lorcet
Age
: 52
Location
: Paraparaumu
Bike
: Specialized Epic 8 EVO, de-evoed! Fox 34SC fork, 120mm both ends. Shimano drivetrain with no electronics, 30t chainring. Dropper post but with the short pilot I really only use it to get on and off, with a tiny bit of drop when it gets wild. Carbon 11 degree sweep bar with Ergon grips, inner bar ends and aero bars (50/50 call on that one). Taking the dynamo again but adding a powerbank for all the time that you're going too slow to charge.
Key items of kit
: Super reliable Revelate Designs bags all round, small and light Sea to Summit sleeping bag, SOL bivvy, self-inflating mat and a fair selection of clothing to be warm in the snow. Garmin Edge and Gaia on the phone for nav, and taking a cooker for some dehy in wild places cause I like a big meal. Taking an Ultimate Direction 12L running vest to reduce the load on the bike in the mountains, and using a home build bike carry harness.
Frame type
: MTB - Full Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Gary Hall
Age
: 50
Location
: Hawkes bay NZ
Bike
: Ti Chiru Pinion Divider
Key items of kit
: Pinion gearbox with chain setup this time complimented with 2.6 Mezcal tires and Brooks Swallow saddle and comfy 120mm Sid fork. Ergon 2 grips and T2 aerobars .
Bivy Klymit air mattress and synthetic puffer jacket for sleeping system. Tiny fuel tablet ti mug cooker for dehydrated meals.
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Titanium
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Adam Carlson
Age
: 48
Location
: Queenstown, NZ
Bike
: Old mate Kona Honzo 2018.
We’ve seen some things, we’re going to see some more.
Dynamo hub powering some Busch Mueller lights.
Shimano for going and stopping.
Mezcals for speed and efficiency.
Key items of kit
: Rab Bivi for sleeping well.
Stove for eating well.
Couple of homemade bags and some bought ones.
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Aluminium
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Karl Arndt
Age
: 45
Location
: Nelson, NZ
Bike
: Trek Stache 7.
Key items of kit
: The main differences between my last TTW ride and this one is that I've added front suspension and aero bars and switched to flat pedals. I've reduced weight elsewhere (sleep system, electronics, no cooker this time, etc). Still rolling a Son dynamo hub and K-Lite front light, and using Maxxis Ikons again. Taking plenty of warm clothes and extra food so I can wait out any storms or river crossings, if needed...
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Aluminium
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Tom Baker
Age
: 43
Cap number
: Team big mouth strikes again
Location
: Queenstown NZ
Bike
: Ritchey Ascent. Steel. Fully rigid. Not quite the ideal bike for the TTW but it’s the only one I got. It’s been down the course before hopefully it remembers the way and goes a bit faster!
Key items of kit
: Mezcals are on now. Because mezcals. 32 tooth on the front. Have upgraded to a suspension stem and seat post. Having a long body and short legs I struggle with the seat bag hitting the rear wheel. So this year I’ve upgraded to a Tailfin Cargo Pack to eliminate this issue. Aero bars are a new addition and I don’t know what I’d do without them. Really enjoying the change in position. It’s almost a rest!
Frame type
: Hardtail - Fully Rigid
Frame material
: Steel
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Martin Grethe
Age
: 54
Location
: Wellington
Bike
: Niner Air 9 RDO
Key items of kit
: Shimano XT & Absolut black Oval 32-10/46. Apidura bags & Stealth frame bag. Sleep kit/shelter: SOL bivy, Rab Siltarp - KiwiUltralight quilt & Exped mat. Nav/tracking: Wahoo Element Roam & Garmin Inreach Mini 2.
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Phill Davies
Age
: 42
Location
: New Plymouth
Bike
: Binary Super Bee
Key items of kit
: Intend BC Samurai USD fork, We Are One wheels, 34X20 gearing, Rockgeist frame bag, Paper Roads top tube bag, Wayward Riders Saddle Harness, Thompson seat post, Specialized Power saddle and custom padded down tube for the HAB.
Frame type
: Hardtail - Front Suspension
Frame material
: Titanium
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No
Emma Bateup
Age
: 26
Location
: Wellington
Bike
: Juliana Wilder with Reserve wheels wrapped in Maxxis Aspens. Burgtec grips & flat pedals (win medals). 32t chainring. OneUp dropper and pump with EDC. Wayward Riders front harness prototype (aero edition) & Silva 6l drybag, BP Bikebags top tube bag, @dirtbag.utility.co frame bag, Apidura downtube bag.
Key items of kit
: Ground Effect clothing. Coros Dura for nav. Silva Strive 10L vest. Hike-a-bike harness. MSR E-bivy & Therm-a-Rest Hyperion bag. Giro Tracker Fastlace shoes. Fenix BC26R light on helmet (plus a spare, I've been learning).
Frame type
: MTB - Full Suspension
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 50mm+
Electronic shifting
: No

Taking an Ultimate Direction 12L running vest to reduce the load on the bike in the mountains, and using a home build bike carry harness.

riders.name: Gary Hall
riders.key_items:
Pinion gearbox with chain setup this time complimented with 2.6 Mezcal tires and Brooks Swallow saddle and comfy 120mm Sid fork. Ergon 2 grips and T2 aerobars .
Bivy Klymit air mattress and synthetic puffer jacket for sleeping system. Tiny fuel tablet ti mug cooker for dehydrated meals.

riders.name: Adam Carlson
riders.key_items:
Rab Bivi for sleeping well.
Stove for eating well.
Couple of homemade bags and some bought ones.

riders.name: Karl Arndt
riders.key_items: The main differences between my last TTW ride and this one is that I've added front suspension and aero bars and switched to flat pedals. I've reduced weight elsewhere (sleep system, electronics, no cooker this time, etc). Still rolling a Son dynamo hub and K-Lite front light, and using Maxxis Ikons again. Taking plenty of warm clothes and extra food so I can wait out any storms or river crossings, if needed...

riders.name: Tom Baker
riders.bike: Ritchey Ascent. Steel. Fully rigid. Not quite the ideal bike for the TTW but it’s the only one I got. It’s been down the course before hopefully it remembers the way and goes a bit faster!
riders.key_items: Mezcals are on now. Because mezcals. 32 tooth on the front. Have upgraded to a suspension stem and seat post. Having a long body and short legs I struggle with the seat bag hitting the rear wheel. So this year I’ve upgraded to a Tailfin Cargo Pack to eliminate this issue. Aero bars are a new addition and I don’t know what I’d do without them. Really enjoying the change in position. It’s almost a rest!

riders.name: Martin Grethe
riders.key_items: Shimano XT & Absolut black Oval 32-10/46. Apidura bags & Stealth frame bag. Sleep kit/shelter: SOL bivy, Rab Siltarp - KiwiUltralight quilt & Exped mat. Nav/tracking: Wahoo Element Roam & Garmin Inreach Mini 2.

riders.name: Phill Davies
riders.key_items: Intend BC Samurai USD fork, We Are One wheels, 34X20 gearing, Rockgeist frame bag, Paper Roads top tube bag, Wayward Riders Saddle Harness, Thompson seat post, Specialized Power saddle and custom padded down tube for the HAB.

riders.name: Emma Bateup
riders.bike: Juliana Wilder with Reserve wheels wrapped in Maxxis Aspens. Burgtec grips & flat pedals (win medals). 32t chainring. OneUp dropper and pump with EDC. Wayward Riders front harness prototype (aero edition) & Silva 6l drybag, BP Bikebags top tube bag, @dirtbag.utility.co frame bag, Apidura downtube bag.
riders.key_items: Ground Effect clothing. Coros Dura for nav. Silva Strive 10L vest. Hike-a-bike harness. MSR E-bivy & Therm-a-Rest Hyperion bag. Giro Tracker Fastlace shoes. Fenix BC26R light on helmet (plus a spare, I've been learning).

title: Granguanche Audax Road 2026
body:
Bikes of Granguanche Audax Road 2026
26 January, 2026
Powered By:
Check out the commentary for Granguanche Audax Road 5
Take a look at the climbing setups chosen by the riders of the 5th edition of GGAR, then take a look at our commentary
here
.
Manu Cattrysse
Age
: 37
Cap number
: 19
Location
: Hamme, Flanders Belgium
Bike
: I will be racing on my beloved Orbea Orca OMX, which has a full SRAM AXS Force groupset and 48-35 and 10-36 gearings. Wheels are a fresh pair of super light Hunt aerodynamicist with UD spokes and 32mm tubeless Schwalbe pro one super race tyres.
Key items of kit
: As always full Tailfin kit, a combination of the speedpack, toptube and wedge framebag. Lights are a Lupine Piko and Exposure diablo as Helmet light and Lezyne rear lights. For navigation i'll use a Garmin Edge Solar 1040 gps.
Frame type
: Road
Frame material
: Carbon
Wheel size
: 700c (29")
Tyre width
: 30-34mm
Electronic shifting
: Yes

: 34
Cap number

Location
: Buchen

Ryzon Cargo Bibs (food, smartphone) Sigma Booster and Blaze lights 2x 950ml Elite bottle Tubolito spare tubes Grmin Edge 530.

Jan
Age
: 48
Cap number
: 47
Location
: Lower Saxony - Germany
Bike
: I ride a Canyon Endurace CFR AXS in size M. Shifting is handled electronically by a SRAM Red AXS drivetrain, reliable and precise – even when the mind is already tired. I run tubeless tires, by conviction and for practical reasons: fewer worries, more focus on riding. The setup is intentionally comfortable, because over long distances it’s not the most aggressive bike that wins, but the most honest one.
Key items of kit
: It’s hard to say what the most important parts of my bike are. In the end, it’s probably not the drivetrain, not the frame, and not the tire pressure. The most important part is sitting on the saddle – mind, legs, and the willingness to keep going when it gets uncomfortable and the inner voice says, “stop.”

Age

Cap number
: 77
Location
: Le Mans
Bike
: FAIRLIGHT Secan 2.1 with customized Shimano GRX 44/28x11/40 and ZOLLA WHEELS. It’s the same bike I had last summer when I scratched the Transcontinental Race No11 after 2000km (I had finished it four times before), I even hasn’t changed chain and tyres. No ultra light gear list, but a complete randonneur package : I only pretend to achieve twice the race time of the incredible Audax pace. I just had to add compulsory rain pants and sea sickness pils !
Key items of kit
:  2015 Apidura x Rapha handlebar for  my sleep system : Katabatic Bristlecone bivy, Sea to Summit mat, Cocoon silk/thermolite liner, Pajak Radiclal X sleeping bag.
An Apidura x MAAP saddle bag for extra clothes (merinos warmers and long-sleeve baselayer, Café du Cycliste dyntex rain jacket, insulated jacket, gloves, socks ).
A Tailfin frame bags for my tools, tubes, papers, medecine and electronics.
And a third bottle cage.

Silk undies, blister bandaids for my butt cheeks and a little wooden giraffe, to generate en-route content for my 3-year old daughter.

riders.name: Michał
riders.bike: Canion Ultimate . 30 wide tyries , sram 12 Axs 46/33 - 10/36 cassette - works for me okey considering the bike was uploaded 10 kg more then usual 😁
riders.key_items: Apidura and Silca bags , 3 L weather capasity works very well. Many places to refill however this is while riding during the day at night this might be limited. Shoes - Udog gravel version works very well as i did not have other shoes with me. Roller 😝 to roll you back after exhousting day 🤪
